availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Patrick Murphy (Hancock County, Kentucky, Liverty Stable Keeper.)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, livery stable keeper. Native of Ireland. Married to Mary Emaline Blanford Murphy in Hancock County, Kentucky, on July 12, 1859. Father of Thomas Murphy, Frank Murphy, and Mary Murphy. Livery stable keeper in Hancock County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p.1034.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 181A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hancock County Marriages, Film #000495729, p. 10.
"Patrick Murphy (1837-1876)," Find A Grave, Memorial #90176981, accessed September 1, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/90176981 .
